alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Pleasants; Ritchie; Wirt; Wood (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued November 18 at 3:12PM EST until November 18 at 3:45PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: The National Weather Service in Charleston West Virginia has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Pleasants County in northwestern West Virginia... Ritchie County in northwestern West Virginia... Wirt County in northwestern West Virginia... Northeastern Jackson County in northwestern West Virginia... Southern Wood County in northwestern West Virginia... * Until 345 PM EST. * At 311 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Belmont to near Elizabeth to near Forked Run State Park, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following highways... Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 150 and 165. Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 18 and 45. Locations impacted include... Harrisville, St. Marys, Elizabeth, Pennsboro, Belmont, North Bend State Park, Ellenboro, Cairo, Pullman, Cherry, Smithville, Maxwell, Schultz, Mountain, Hebron, Pike, Berea, Brohard, Macfarlan and Highland. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. If traveling on a highway, find the nearest exit or rest area and park safely away from traffic. Allow snow squalls to pass before attempting to resume travel.
